item.title: Breaking Down Custom OMA-URI (CSP) Policies
item.description: What is an OMA-URI Policy? Meaning: Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier Traditionally when you implement a new piece of software which contains Group Policy Objects (GPO’s) to customise the feature of the application you would import the .adml and .admx files into the PolicyDefinitions folder located within SysVol (SYSVOL) for the domain or into the local PolicyDefinitions (C:/WindowsPolicyDefinitions) folder.

item.title: Getting Useful Device Information… Troubleshooting Made Easy
item.description: SO… I’ve been working tirelessly in trying to get an Autopilot Hybrid Deployment working along with my colleagues. As any Tech does I give everything my blood sweat and tears before logging a call with support (Sound silly as we could waste hours… But where’s the fun in just logging a call), however on occasion you have to admit defeat and raise a service request.

item.title: Contact | Talk To Me Anytime :)
item.description: Ask Us Anything Or just Say Hi,

item.title: David Brook
item.description: I am an experienced End User Computing Engineer who works on delivering Modern Desktop concepts using Microsoft Intune and Configuration Manager. I’ve worked in IT for the past 8+ years with over 6 of those been a 3rd Line/Senior Engineer delivering solution to Medium/Large enterprise environments. I have worked on Micro Focus Novell ZENworks with ENGL Imaging, Which offered the traditional ‘Gold Image’ creation with the additional driver packs layered on top.
